title: SF_EnableSwitch (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SF_EnableSwitch
The function block SF_EnableSwitch FB evaluates the signals of an enable switch with three positions.

rows:
Confirmation of the safe mode (limitation of the speed or the power of motion, limitation of the range of motion).
FALSE: Safe mode is not active. TRUE: Safe mode is active.

Signal of contacts E1 and E2 of the connected enable switch.
FALSE: Connected switches are open. TRUE: Connected switches
are closed..

Signal of contacts E3 and E4 of the connected enable switch.
FALSE: Connected switches are open. TRUE: Connected switches
are closed.
Behaviour on error of safety FB

rows.Name: Ready
rows.Comment:
Activation of the FB. TRUE indicates that the FB is
activated and the outputs results are valid, FALSE the FB is
not active and the program is not executed.

rows:
Safety related output: Indicates suspension of guard. FALSE:
Disable suspension of safeguarding. TRUE: Enable suspension
of safeguarding.

Output indicating that the FB is active and the primary
safety function is demanded (e.g. related to the safety
functionality).

Output which can be used to signal the operator to press the
reset functionality to continue.
